column1: #Text=Polycrystalline specimens of Li(Cd,Mn)P were prepared by solid state reaction with high purity elements.
#Text=The stoichiometric ratios of starting materials were well mixed and pressed into pellets.
#Text=All the processes were performed under the protection of high-purity Argon due to the air sensitivity of precursors and products.
#Text=The pellets were sealed in Ta tubes under 0.5 bar of Argon before being sealed into evacuated quartz tubes.
#Text=The samples were heated at 470 °C for 48 h.
#Text=Then the products were reground and sintered at 680 °C for 48 h, followed by a quick quenching to room temperature.
#Text=The recovered samples were characterized by X-ray powder diffraction (XRD) with a Philips X’pert diffractometer using CuKα radiation.
#Text=Cd, Mn and P) were determined by using energy dispersive analysis (EDX) on a commercial Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM).
#Text=Microstructure was studied by high resolution Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM).

#Text=The dc magnetic properties were examined by using Superconductivity Quantum Interference Device (SQUID, Quantum design), and transport properties were examined by Physical Property Measurement System (PPMS, Quantum design).
#Text=We calculated the electronic structures by using the density functional theory (DFT) implemented in the code QUANTUM ESPRESSO36.

#Text=The exchange-correlation interactions are described by the Perdew-Burke-Ernzerhof generalized gradients approximation (GGA), and the electronion interactions are represented by the Vanderbilt ultrasoft pseudopotentials.
